Sweet and Sour Pork Ribs

Source: cookidoo.thermomix.com

Description

None

Directions

Place vegetable oil and ginger into mixing bowl and cook 3 min/250°F/speed 1.

Add pork ribs, rock sugar, Chinese rice wine, rice vinegar and soy sauce, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 22-25 min/250°F//speed , depending on size of ribs. Serve hot.

Tips & tricks

Garnish with green onions, sliced on the bias.

Replace rock sugar with jaggary sugar or panela sugar.

To remove the odor from raw pork: before cooking, place 18 oz pork spare ribs, cut into pieces (2 in.) into mixing bowl, cover ribs with water and blanch 30 min/100°F//speed . Set ribs aside, dry mixing bowl, and continue with recipe.

For riblets, have the butcher cut ribs in half.

Ingredients

½ oz vegetable oil ½ oz fresh ginger, thinly sliced 18 oz pork spare ribs, cut into pieces (2 in.) 2 oz crumb rock sugar 1 oz Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Diao) 2 oz rice vinegar 1 oz soy sauce

Notes

None

Nutrition

Calories: 1368 kJ / 327 kcal Protein: 26 g Carbohydrates: 16 g Fat: 17 g Fiber: 0 g
